document.docAuthor: De, Gilberto J., Zannou, Ignace D., Ueckermann, Eddie A., Oliveira, Anibal R., Hanna, Rachid & Yaninek, John S.
document.masterDocTitle: Phytoseiid mites of the tribe Paraseiulini Wainstein (Acari: Phytoseiidae) from sub-Saharan Africa

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Phytoseiid mites of the tribe Paraseiulini Wainstein (Acari: Phytoseiidae) from sub-Saharan Africa

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Amblydromella ( Aphanoseia ) querella
,
Denmark & Welbourn, 2002
: 308
.
Kuzinellus querellus ,
Moraes et al. , 2004
: 273
;

.

subSubSection.paragraph: FEMALE. (Specimens measured. Burundi : 1 ; Sierra-Leone: 1 ; South Africa : Holotype and 8 paratypes ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 14.
Kuzinellus querellus
(Ueckermann & Loots)
: A. Female dorsal shield; B. Female ventral surface; C. Spermatheca; D. Female chelicera; E. Female leg IV; F. Spermatodactyl; G. Male ventrianal shield.

subSubSection.paragraph: Venter. Sternal shield smooth, with two pairs of sternal setae (ST 3 inserted on membrane); posterior margin concave, very lightly sclerotized centrally; distances between ST 1 -ST 3 64 ( 61–67 ) [ 67 ], ST 2 -ST 2 53 ( 51– 56 ) [ 52 ]. Genital shield smooth; distance between ST 5 -ST 5 54 ( 51–56 ) [ 52 ]. Ventrianal shield smooth, pentagonal, constricted laterally at level of preanal pores, anterior margin straight or convex, 122 ( 115–129 ) [ 123 ] long, 83 ( 79–90 ) [ 87 ] wide at level of ZV 2, 76 ( 72–81 ) [ 79 ] wide at level of anus; setae JV 2 and JV 3 present; elliptical preanal pores posteromesad to JV 2 . Caudoventral setae smooth and sharp-tipped, except JV 5 , knobbed.
Chelicera. Movable digit 31 ( 28–33 ) [ 31 ] long with 3 teeth; fixed digit 28 ( 25–31 ) [ 28 ] long, with 5 teeth (proximal 2 teeth closely associated) and a pilus dentilis .
Spermatheca. Calyx saccular, narrow near atrium, 11 ( 8–12 ) [ 9 ] long; atrium small, only distinguishable as lips.

Legs. Knobbed macrosetae: Sbt (macroseta of basitarsus) 28 ( 25–35 ) [ 26 ] and Stt (macroseta of telotarsus) 24 ( 20–27 ) [ 22 ]. Chaetotaxy: genu II: 2 - 2 / 0, 2 / 0-1 ; genu III: 1-2 / 1, 2 / 0-1 .
Peritreme. Extending to level of j 1 .

Venter. Ventrianal shield subtriangular, with transverse striae anteriorly to anus, 101 long, 129 wide at the anterior corners; with 4 pairs of preanal setae (JV 1 -JV 3 and ZV 2 ), 3 pairs of lyrifissures ( 1 sub-lateral and almost in line with JV 1, 1 lateral and slightly posterior to JV 1 and 1 lateral and lightly posterior to ZV 2 ) and a pair of elliptical preanal pores mesad of and slightly posterior to JV 2 . Caudoventral setae smooth and sharptipped.
Spermatodactyl. Curved distally with small pointed process on curve, ending in a knob, shaft 18 ( 14-21 ) long.
Legs. Macrosetae knobbed: Sbt 25 ( 23–27 ), Stt 21 ( 20–22 ). Chaetotaxy of genua II and III same as in female.

Specimens examined. One female,
Burundi :
9 km S Rutana, on
Markhamia obtusifolia
,
13 -XII- 1989
, J.S. Yaninek, deposited at ESALQ-USP. One female, Sierra-Leone: 36 km N Makeni, on
Citrus
sp.,
16 -XII- 1991
, B. Kristensen, deposited at ESALQ-USP.
South Africa :
Holotype female from
Hemizygia parvifolia , Blyde
River Poort, Mpumalanga Province,
23 -II- 1978
, M.K.P. Smith Meyer; 2 paratype females from
Cymbopogon validus
, 30 km from East London to Umtata, Eastern cape Province,
9 -II- 1974
, F.W. Schultz; 2 paratype females from
Solanum hermannii
, 40 km from Peddie to East London, Eastern cape Province,
12 -II- 1974
, F.W. Schultz; one paratype female from
Schkuhria pinnata ,
40 km from Peddie to East London, Eastern cape Province,
12 -II- 1974
, L.C. Smit; one paratype female from
Hypoestes
sp., Keiskamma River between East London and Peddie, Eastern Cape province,
12 -II- 1974
, L.C. Smit; one paratype male and female from
Helichrysum cymosum , Gonubie Beach
, Eastern Cape Province,
9 -II- 1974
, L.C. Smit; one paratype male and female from
Lippia javanica
, between Modimole (previously Nylstroom) and Bella Bella (previously Warm Baths), Limpopo Province,
5 -V- 1981
, E.A. Ueckermann; all deposited at NCA-PPRI.

Remarks. The specimens from Burundi and Sierra-Leone have posterior margin of sternal shield indistinct and anterior margin of the ventrianal shield convex. In addition to the macrosetae, 1 paratype female has a knobbed seta on each of tibia III, basitarsus III, genu IV, tibia IV and basitarsus IV; the single female from each of Sierra-Leone and Burundi and 2 paratype females have a knobbed seta on each of genu IV, tibia IV and basitarsus IV; 1 paratype female has a knobbed seta on each of basitarsi III and IV; 5 paratype females have a short and knobbed seta on basitarsus IV.
World distribution. Burundi , Sierra-Leone, South Africa and Zimbabwe .
